description: One step to improve the rendering time of your application is to have a look at the GPU Overdraw tool.
title: Optimizing Layouts in Android - Reducing Overdraw

description: Some time ago the author found a case of a really curious behaviour - PDF pages rendered to a Bitmap with transparent background showed strange artifacts around text. Here's what it was.
title: The curious case of Android premultiplied alpha

description: Thomas Nield takes a hand-on approach to understand observeOn() and subscribeOn().
title: RxJava- Understanding observeOn() and subscribeOn()

description: One of the nicest features of OkHttp is its caching mechanism. In this post Damian Petla goes through all relevant steps in caching and explain how it works
title: What's under the hood of the OkHttp's cache?

description: You never know what might kill your Activity, which is why you need to be prepared!
title: Activity Revival and the case of the Rotating Device

description: In this example the author shows how to use Realm database in app with MVP architecture and Dagger library.
title: Example of Realm with MVP and Dagger

description: Hannes Dorfmann highlights how important an presentation model in MVP is by giving an example how to deal with RecyclerView Adapters dataset changes, how to apply animated dataset changes and why a presentation model is helpful in this case.
title: AdapterCommands

description: This post sheds some light on a networking architecture that can fit easily into the MVP pattern while also allowing our network requests to live beyond the life of an activity/fragment with very little effort
title: A MVP Approach to Lifecycle Safe Requests with RxJava

description: Donn Felker describes a novel way to use Fabric's new screengrab tool to simplify validation of your internationalized application.
title: Automating Screenshots: Simplifying Internationalization

description: In this series Mark Allison will create an approximation of the material circular indeterminate ProgressBar which will be backwardly compatible to API 11.
title: Indeterminate – Part 1

description: One of the main features of Kotlin that Vishnu Rajeevan fallen in love with is class extensions. This feature comes in handy quite often when working with APIs that are not yet RxJava compatible in a project that is using RxJava extensively.
title: Using Kotlin Extensions for Rx-ifying

description: Improving application startup and load time has been a priority for The New York Times Android development team. Here's some of the work they did.
title: Improving Startup Time in the NYTimes Android App

description: The brains behind Weather and Clock Widget, a Top 40 app with 50M+ downloads, grappled with challenges all too common to large publishers. After dealing with an in-house solution and numerous ad networks, they turned to Appodeal's programmatic ad mediation. The result? A 53% increase in ad revenue.
title: How a Top 40 App Increased Its Ad Revenue by 53%

description: Android developers are in demand, so shouldn't companies apply to you? On Hired, that's exactly how it works. Get 5+ job offers from companies like Uber, Stripe, and Facebook with 1 application. Join Hired today and get a 1k bonus when you get a job!
title: Hired - The Marketplace for Android Developer Jobs

description: MJD Interactive is busy building the future, and we’re looking for a Senior Mobile Engineers that want to help us make sure it works.
title: Senior Android Engineer

description: We are looking for someone with serious Android  Software Development skills, strong interests in all things mobile, and a passion for delivering high quality, rock-solid appsBachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related technical field1 or more apps in the Google Play Store
title: Senior Mobile Developer / Android / 100% remote

description: Automated localized screenshots of your Android app on every device
title: screengrab

description: The Android tools team just pushed Android Studio 2.0 Beta 4 to the canary channel, as well as 2.0.0-beta4 of the Gradle plugin to jcenter.
title: Android Studio 2.0 Beta 4 Available

description: Square fixed a certificate pinning vulnerability in OkHttp 3.1.2, and backported that to OkHttp 2.7.4.
title: OkHttp Certificate Pinning Vulnerability!

description: This week on The Developer Show, join Timothy Jordan for a beefy TL;DR with a bunch of great links.
title: The Developer Show 013

description: This video dives into an RxAndroid tutorial and tries out all the basics and explain most of the ins and outs of how these examples work!
title: Introduction to RxAndroid by Example

description: In this video the team introduces the upcoming Q&A segment and talk about the kinds of questions that they'll answer on the show. Hint: they'd love focused questions that we can answer in 5-10 minutes. Please start posting us your questions!
title: Android Dialogs: Q & A Intro

description: Liam Spradlin designs a new premium flow/screen and a new illustration for Focus, an Android app he designed with developer Francisco Franco.
title: Designing a new premium flow for Focus

description: The only free book about Android programming using Agile tools & techniques.  Help us to complete the writing: become a backer, rewards start at only 5$! This book is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License. Which makes it free to download and share.
title: Agile Android Software Development book
